bhtAttempts.bht: Recognition and confession of Jesus as the Son of God is not just a mere proclamation of words, but a genuine belief from the heart. It is this sincere acknowledgment that proves one's connection with the life of God. This confession goes beyond empty words, insincere claims, or a shallow understanding of the truth; it is an authentic expression of faith and love for Christ. True confession requires a heartfelt belief in Jesus, leading to righteousness, life, and salvation, along with a joyful obedience to His commands. Only those who confess Christ from a principle of loving faith, openly and unflinchingly, truly have God abiding in them.

Genuine belief in Jesus as the Son of God, confessed openly and sincerely, is the proof of one's connection with the life of God. This confession is not just a matter of empty words or insincere claims, but a heartfelt acknowledgment that leads to righteousness, life, and salvation. It goes beyond superficiality and requires a joyful obedience to His commands. True confession comes from a place of loving faith and demonstrates that God abides in those who make such a genuine declaration.

Genuine confession that Jesus is the Son of God proves the life of God within. It is not a matter of empty words, but a heartfelt belief from the core. This confession is not simply a mere proclamation, but a sincere acknowledgment. It involves not only saying with the lips but believing in the heart. Only when confession is accompanied by a genuine faith and love for Christ, resulting in obedience to His commands, can we truly experience the abiding presence of God.

Recognition and confession of Jesus as the Son of God is not just a mere proclamation, but a genuine belief from the heart. Whosoever confesses from a principle of loving faith openly declares in the face of opposition and danger that Jesus is the Son of God. This confession, accompanied by a genuine faith and love for Christ, and joyful obedience to His commands, demonstrates that God abides in them and unites Himself with them. It is this sincere acknowledgment that proves one's connection with the life of God.

Genuine confession of Jesus as the Son of God, from a principle of loving faith, openly declares in the face of opposition and danger that God abides in them. This confession requires heartfelt belief and cheerful obedience, going beyond empty words and insincere claims. It demonstrates a true connection with the life of God and is a proof of one's faith. Faith and confession are used interchangeably, as mere assent to Jesus' divinity does not lead to what follows—a genuine belief in Christ, accompanied by love and obedience.
